TopicTitle: [1.9.x] EvaFuel Continued. No more infinite EVA Fuel!

Articles.Content:
On 4/19/2020 at 5:40 PM, Goufalite said:

in my case the stranded kerbal (per contract) gave me the warning of "0 fuel" and he had no EVA fuel.

I solved this problem by manipulating rescue ship so kerbonaut was able to get into. It was hard.

Thanks linuxgurugamer as usual!

On 4/21/2020 at 3:26 AM, linuxgurugamer said:

New release, 1.6.8

  • Thanks to github user @Goufalite for this improvement:
    • Check if the rescue ship has a name given by the contract (debris, wreck,...)
    • Fix the rescue ship name verification

Hi, linuxgurugamer!

I use russian language and rescue ship still do not give 1 unit of fuel to EVA.

Also when I use KIS EVA tanks Kerbal cannot refil. I asked IgorZ in his thread also.

MADLAD give me this error:

Matched CC_RemoteTech to the whitelist. Suppressing error
Matched KerKonConConExt to the whitelist. Suppressing error
[2020-05-02 22:14:07]: FileNotFoundException: Could not load file or assembly 'KSPDev_Utils.2.1, Version=2.1.7279.39857, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' or one of its dependencies.

44 minutes ago, Sebra said:

I use russian language and rescue ship still do not give 1 unit of fuel to EVA.

What the stranded ship's name? (and an English translation).

28 minutes ago, Goufalite said:

What the stranded ship's name? (and an English translation).

"Летательный аппарат Данбали". Last word is Kerbal name ofc.

It means "Flying apparatus of Danbal" or something like it.

Cannot remember, where to change game language to see it in english.

You need to provide the entire log

3 hours ago, linuxgurugamer said:

You need to provide the entire log

https://ufile.io/lpmznsgq

Yes, please.

Hope it helps!

Thank you in advance!

@linuxgurugamer

The SpaceDock link's description is completely empty, which may not matter if you are getting it from the forum, but for people who download mods from spacedock solely (like I do sometimes), it would be handy if you could copy and paste the relevant info from the OP to the spaceDock link. It would really help some people!

21 minutes ago, mabdi36 said:

@linuxgurugamer

The SpaceDock link's description is completely empty, which may not matter if you are getting it from the forum, but for people who download mods from spacedock solely (like I do sometimes), it would be handy if you could copy and paste the relevant info from the OP to the spaceDock link. It would really help some people!

I copied part of the OP in, but the link to the forum is there, anyone who has questions can always click that.

On 11/6/2019 at 5:17 AM, linuxgurugamer said:

New release, 1.6.7.3

  • Thanks to @Zer0kerbal for this:
    • Create AddPodMonoPropollant.cfg
      • Make sure all Pods(crewCapacity>0) (should also include pods in rescue  contracts) have at least 5 units of MonoPropellant
    • Create ConvertEVATanktoMonoPropellant.cfg to convert EvaPropellant to monoprop

Even Squad's round pods still do not have monopropellant.

ConvertEVATanktoMonoPropellant.cfg break KIS refueling.

57 minutes ago, Sebra said:

Even Squad's round pods still do not have monopropellant.

ConvertEVATanktoMonoPropellant.cfg break KIS refueling.

KIS refueling does what, exactly?

2 hours ago, linuxgurugamer said:

KIS refueling does what, exactly?

Refueling EVA propellant from KIS inventory canister.

Even if Kerbal get EVA propellant from Monopropellant in the exit moment, KIS canister still need EVA propellant, but this patch change fuel type.

And somehow AddPodMonoPropollant.cfg do not add Monopropellant even to stock round cabins in my game. I do not understand this script, May be you can fix it.

I sent you ksp.log week ago. May send another if needed.

1 hour ago, Sebra said:

Refueling EVA propellant from KIS inventory canister.

Even if Kerbal get EVA propellant from Monopropellant in the exit moment, KIS canister still need EVA propellant, but this patch change fuel type.

And somehow AddPodMonoPropollant.cfg do not add Monopropellant even to stock round cabins in my game. I do not understand this script, May be you can fix it.

I sent you ksp.log week ago. May send another if needed.

I don't need a log for this, will look at it tomorrow night, if not sooner

Unfortunately I have the same problem in my case the kerbal (via rescue contract) give me the warning of "0 fuel" and he had no EVA fuel.

Any advice? Many Thanks in advance
Hello! Does this work with the EVA fuel canisters in KIS? I use them very often as I find them extremely helpful and I would be extremely sad if this does not work with it.

@linuxgurugamer Sorry to interrupt but would be grateful if you could see question asked above about KIS fuel canisters.

 

Edit: nvm, checked the source and it does, and also checked the spacedock and saw it does. I really am thick skulled lol

Edited May 29, 2020 by mabdi36

Any news About this? Unfortunately I have the same problem in my case the kerbal (via rescue contract) give me the warning of "0 fuel" and he had no EVA fuel.

Any advice? Many Thanks in advance

As a workaround you can disable the mod in the difficulty settings only during the rescue.

What is the name of the stranded ship?
Note on 1.11 it still removes Monoprop for the RCS pack, but does not remove anything for the extended RCS Tank (the one with 3 units of fuel).

I'm having an issue in KSP 1.11, where the monoprop is removed from the tanks when a kerbal goes outside but not added back when the kerbal returns. So, as an example, if you have 10 monoprop in the Mk1 Pod and just step outside and back quickly 2 times in a row, you are left with 0 monoprop.

On 1/13/2021 at 9:56 PM, woodbyte said:

I'm having an issue in KSP 1.11, where the monoprop is removed from the tanks when a kerbal goes outside but not added back when the kerbal returns. So, as an example, if you have 10 monoprop in the Mk1 Pod and just step outside and back quickly 2 times in a row, you are left with 0 monoprop.

Have you tried this in 1.10?  If not, can you do so and report back?
I think it was working fine in 1.10, but perhaps not. Don't keep different versions of the game so I can't easily verify if that was the case, sorry.

Apparently in 1.11.1 they added an attribute to prevent jetpacks from reloading fuel : https://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/26944 (at the bottom)

I'll try later but since the setting is part dependant it might mean that a Kerbal would have to use another jetpack if one is depleted. Sound interesting...

20 hours ago, Goufalite said:

Apparently in 1.11.1 they added an attribute to prevent jetpacks from reloading fuel : https://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/26944 (at the bottom)

I'll try later but since the setting is part dependant it might mean that a Kerbal would have to use another jetpack if one is depleted. Sound interesting...

 

This mod won't work in 1.11 until I get around to fixing it.  Requires some changes since the kerbal doesn't have fuel, but the jetpack does.

Also, that report you linked to specifically says its only a problem with non-stock fuel.  Regardless, the link will be useful since it mentions a workaround

Edited January 31, 2021 by linuxgurugamer

Hello,

While working my OreToParts mod I managed to succesfully refuel kerbal jetpacks using stock or custom resources! It works but is a little downgraded compared to EVA Fuel : 

  • Not automatic, you need to push a button to refuel stuff
  • Kerbal inventory must be persistent in the difficulty settings
  • Uses only the resources of the part where the kerbals are sitting
  • Needs a MM patch to force jetpacks and eva cylinder to not refuel

More info (at the bottom)

 

Edited September 27, 2021 by Goufalite
persistent inventory as a prerequisite
Is this still needed in KSP? I just came back to playing and wondering if vanilla KSP added this feature. This mod was kind of a essential one, something I hoped KSP1 added someday.
